parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The provided post does not contain a CMF number. While the absence of a CMF number is not automatically disqualifying, it suggests the post might not be directly linked to official electoral campaign materials.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post does not explicitly mention any specific parliamentary candidate by name or surname.  However, the byline clearly states "Partidul Alianța pentru Unirea Românilor" (AUR), which is a political party participating in the parliamentary elections. This implicitly refers to the candidates of that party.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, inherently designed to reach a wide audience. The message "Votați pentru o României puternică!" (Vote for a strong Romania!) is a general call to action, but implicitly encourages voters to support AUR.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The primary objective of the post appears to be influencing voters to support AUR. The message promotes a "strong Romania" and contrasts it with unspecified "multinaționale" (multinationals), implying that AUR represents the interests of the Romanian people against foreign interests. This is a common tactic in electoral campaigns to garner support.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post does not present itself as journalistic content. It lacks the objectivity and neutrality expected from journalistic reporting. Instead, it promotes a specific political party and its agenda.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The post does not express a personal opinion; rather, it promotes a political party's platform. The call to action directly aims to influence voting behavior.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>888476750124491</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post, while not explicitly naming a candidate, strongly promotes AUR. The message, targeting a wide audience through a paid Facebook advertisement, aims to influence voters to support the party.  The absence of a CMF number raises questions about its official status within the AUR campaign, but doesn't negate its propagandistic nature. The timing of the post is crucial; if it falls outside the legally defined electoral propaganda period, it would constitute a violation.  The content itself, even if within the allowed period, walks a fine line due to its implicit call to action and potentially misleading generalizations about multinationals.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>All AUR candidates</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>AUR</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
[Entitatea responsabilă de postare], pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei reclame plătite pe Facebook după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, cu mesajul "Votați pentru o României puternică! Pentru oameni care să reprezinte interesul poporului român, nu interesul multinaționalelor!", care promovează implicit Partidul Alianța pentru Unirea Românilor (AUR) și are ca efect electoral influențarea votului în favoarea candidaților AUR,  fără a respecta prevederile legale privind perioada de campanie electorală.  Mesajul, deși nu numește candidați specifici, are un efect clar de propagandă electorală, vizând o audiență largă prin intermediul unei reclame plătite pe o platformă publică. ID-ul postării pe Facebook este 888476750124491.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
